<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Battle Medicine](/Feats.aspx?ID=760) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 258 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9)

**Requirements**
You are holding [healer's tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=25), or you are wearing them and have a hand free

</column>

---

You can patch up wounds, even in combat. Attempt a [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9) check with the same DC as for [Treat Wounds](/Actions.aspx?ID=57) and restore the corresponding amount of HP; this doesn't remove the [wounded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=42) condition. As with Treat Wounds, you can attempt checks against higher DCs if you have the minimum proficiency rank. The target is then temporarily immune to your Battle Medicine for 1 day.

<title level="2">Battle Medicine leads to...</title>
[Godless Healing](/Feats.aspx?ID=869), [Medic Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=2027), [Paragon Battle Medicine](/Feats.aspx?ID=2171)
